hints.content:
Let's put our numbers into a place value table.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
- | :-: | :-: | :-:
$\maroonD{189}$ |  $\maroonD1$ | $\maroonD8$ | $\maroonD9$
$\blueE{608}$ | $\blueE6$ | $\blueE0$ | $\blueE8$

Now, we can break apart each number by place value.

$\maroonD{189}=\maroonD{1\text{ hundred}} + \maroonD{8\text{ tens}} + \maroonD{9\text{ ones}}$.  

$\blueE{608}=\blueE{6\text{ hundreds}} + \blueE{8\text{ ones}}$.
$1\text{ hundred} + 6\text{ hundreds} + 8 \text{ tens}+9 \text{ ones}+8 \text{ ones}$ is the same as $189 + 608$.

question.content:
Mike isn't sure how to add $189+608$.

**Help Mike by choosing an addition problem that is  the same as $189+608$.**
